definition: to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Emotionalism and sentimentality prevent the sensitivity of feeling.
sentences.chinese: 多愁善感和感情用事妨碍了感觉的敏锐。

sentences.english: There's no room for sentiment in business.
sentences.chinese: 做生意不能婆婆妈妈的感情用事。
感情用事使这次讨论混乱不堪。

sentences.english: Sentiment and eloquence serve only to impede the pursuit of truth.
sentences.chinese: 感情用事和夸夸其谈只能阻碍对真理的追求。

sentences.english: If you find yourself contemplating firing a client, chances are your emotions are running high.
sentences.chinese: 如果你打算炒掉客户，很可能你在感情用事。

sentences.english: A sensible environmentalism does not sentimentalize the earth.
sentences.chinese: 理智的环境保护论对地球不感情用事。

sentences.english: We must rein our emotions and not be swayed by them.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须控制住感情，而不能感情用事。

sentences.english: They say President Lincoln never slopped over.
sentences.chinese: 他们说林肯总统从不感情用事。

sentences.english: Would you want an emotional pilot?
sentences.chinese: 你们想要一个感情用事的飞行员么？
在这件事上他感情用事。

sentences.english: But showing emotion on the trading floor is still a controversial subject.
sentences.chinese: 但在交易场所感情用事仍是个有争议的话题。

sentences.english: It was an emotional issue. I hope you can forgive us.
sentences.chinese: 这是感情用事所做出的决定，希望你们能原谅我们。

sentences.english: There's no place for sentiment in Business.
sentences.chinese: 做生意不能婆婆妈妈的感情用事。

sentences.english: They have enough distance from the problem as not to get too emotionally involved.
sentences.chinese: 他们对于你的问题有足够的距离不至于感情用事。

definition: to let emotions affect one's decisions
lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem/to bash one's head against a brick wall/a wild goose chase/a blind alley/to split hairs
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
